properties.Name: PolicyAssignment
properties.Description:
People who purchase life insurance policies actually own their policies and may do with them as they wish - including giving them away or transferring them just as any other kind of property.

This transfer is known as an Assignment.

Assignment is the transfer by the policyholder of legal rights or interest in the insurance policy contract to a third party

The assignment procedures normally requires that the policy owner notify the company in writing.

The new owner of the policy is known as the assignee.

The assignee is granted all rights policy ownership.

There are two types of assignments:  Absolute and Collateral

Columns.Name: InsurancePolicyId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Insurance Policy.

Columns.Name: AssignmentDeclaredDate
Columns.Description: The date that the Assignment was declared to the Insurer.

Columns.Name: PartyId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Party.

Columns.Name: AssignmentEffectiveDate
Columns.Description: The date that the Assignment was effective.

Columns.Name: DateAssignorNotified
Columns.Description: The date that the Assignor was notified of the change of Policy ownership.

Columns.Name: PolicyAssignmentTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Policy Assignment Type.

Columns.Name: AssigneeRelationshipTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of the Assignee Relationship.

Columns.Name: AssignmentNote
Columns.Description: A note, comment or additional information regarding the policy assignment.

Properties.Description:
People who purchase life insurance policies actually own their policies and may do with them as they wish - including giving them away or transferring them just as any other kind of property.

This transfer is known as an Assignment.

Assignment is the transfer by the policyholder of legal rights or interest in the insurance policy contract to a third party

The assignment procedures normally requires that the policy owner notify the company in writing.

The new owner of the policy is known as the assignee.

The assignee is granted all rights policy ownership.

There are two types of assignments:  Absolute and Collateral
